alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 8:11PM EDT until August 12 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... Southeastern Ulster County in east central New York... Southern Dutchess County in east central New York... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 811 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Dover Plains to Myers Corner to near Bloomingburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, New Milford, Beacon, Sherman, Pawling, Wallkill, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Wappingers Falls, Kent, Highland, Fishkill, Millbrook, Modena, Gaylordsville, Fairview, Hopewell Junction, Marlboro, Red Oaks Mill and Myers Corner. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
